intro: Asperula naufraga, commonly known as the wandering jenny, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Asperula naufraga is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
